Variant annotation pipeline¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

The Variants pipeline attempts to annotate variants in a vcf formatted file. It computes

  1. the effects of SNPs on transcripts and genes

This pipeline works on a single genome.

Overview¶

Usage¶

See Setting up a pipeline and Running a pipeline on general information how to use CGAT pipelines.

Configuration¶

The pipeline requires a configured pipeline.ini file.

The sphinxreport report requires a conf.py and sphinxreport.ini file (see Building pipeline reports). To start with, use the files supplied with the Example data.

Input¶

Variants¶

Variants are read from a vcf formatted file called variants.vcf.gz. The file is assumed to have been compressed with bgzip and compressed with tabix.

The tracks are taken from the headers in the vcf file. Please avoid any special characters like _][*.+- within strain names.

The pipeline expects the following information within the genotype field in the vcf file:

GT
The genotype
DP
The read depth

Optional inputs¶

Requirements¶

The pipeline requires the results from Annotation pipeline. Set the configuration variable annotations_database and annotations_dir.

On top of the default CGAT setup, the pipeline requires the following software to be in the path:

Program Version Purpose
polyphen >=2.0.23 prediction of deleterious substitutions

Pipeline output¶

The major output is in the database file csvdb.

Example¶

Example data is available at http://www.cgat.org/~andreas/sample_data/pipeline_variants.tgz. To run the example, simply unpack and untar:

wget http://www.cgat.org/~andreas/sample_data/pipeline_variants.tgz
tar -xvzf pipeline_variants.tgz
cd pipeline_variants
python <srcdir>/pipeline_variants.py make full

Note

For the pipeline to run, install the Annotation pipeline as well.

Glossary¶

polyphen
polyphen - a program to predict the deleteriousness of substitutions

Code¶

pipeline_variants.connect()¶

connect to database.

This method also attaches to helper databases.

pipeline_variants.indexGenome(infile, outfile)¶

index the genome for samtools.

Samtools does not like long lines, so create a new file with split lines (what a waste).

pipeline_variants.importPseudogenes(infile, outfile)¶

import pseudogene data from pseudogenes.org

pipeline_variants.importMGI(infile, outfile)¶

create via BIOMART

pipeline_variants.loadGene2Omim(infile, outfile)¶

download gene id - OMIM associations via BIOMART.

Missing numerical entries are set to 0 (from -2147483648).

pipeline_variants.loadHumanOrthologs(infile, outfile)¶

download human2mouse orthologs

pipeline_variants.buildSelenoList(infile, outfile)¶

export a list of seleno cysteine transcripts.

pipeline_variants.loadEnsembl2Uniprot(infile, outfile)¶

load mapping from ENSEMBL transcripts ids to uniprot ids.

This method expects an BioMart output file with the following five columns: Ensembl gene id, Ensembl transcript id, Uniprot Swissprot Id, Uniprot Accession Uniport/Trembl Accession

build base annotations

pipeline_variants.buildExonAnnotations(infile, outfile)¶

build exon annotations

pipeline_variants.buildGeneAnnotations(infile, outfile)¶

build gene annotations.

Merge exons per gene within the reference set. The output includes the UTR and non-coding genes.

pipeline_variants.makeGeneCounts(infile, outfile)¶

coun gene exon statistics.

pipeline_variants.buildAnnotations(infile, outfile, sample)¶

annotate snps with gene set.

pipeline_variants.loadAnnotations(infile, outfile)¶

load annotations

pipeline_variants.summarizeAnnotations(infile, outfile)¶

compute summary stats for annotation files.

load annotations

pipeline_variants.buildEffects(infile, outfile, sample)¶

annotate snps with gene set.

pipeline_variants.loadEffects(infile, outfile)¶

load transcript effects into tables.

pipeline_variants.mergeEffects(infiles, outfile)¶

load transcript effects into single table.

pipeline_variants.buildAlleles(infile, outfile, sample)¶

annotate snps with gene set.

pipeline_variants.loadAlleles(infile, outfile)¶

load allele.

pipeline_variants.summarizeAllelesPerTranscript(infile, outfile)¶

summarize effects on a per-gene level.

The following fields are exclusive:

is_wildtype
both alleles are wildtype
is_knockout
both alleles knocked out
is_truncated
both alleles truncated or truncated and knocked out
is_affected
one allele is truncated or knocked out

The other fields are not necessarily exclusive, for example there could be transcripts with one knocked out allele and one wildtype allele, such that is_nmd_affected, is_affected and has_wildtype are all true.

pipeline_variants.summarizeAllelesPerGene(infile, outfile)¶

summarize effects on a per-gene level.

pipeline_variants.summarizeEffectsPerGene(infile, outfile)¶

summarize effects on a per-gene level.

pipeline_variants.makeSNPCountsPerGene(infiles, outfile)¶

count snps within genes

pipeline_variants.setupMultipleAlignment(infiles, outfile)¶

prepare input files for multiple alignment computations.

This script does some id-mapping to resolve coordinates.

Basically, each genome is separated into two alleles. Gene_id’s will be suffixed with the allele_id. This ensures that exons of a gene with multiple transcipts will be resolved correctly with consistent coordinates.

From an alignment point of view, the two alleles of the genes will be treated independently, but transcripts within a gene will be merged correctly at exon boundaries, again on a per-allele basis.

Later, when collecting the results, the allele id is moved from the gene to the transcript.

pipeline_variants.buildMultipleAlignments(infile, outfile)¶

build multiple alignments.

pipeline_variants.buildMultipleAlignmentVariantColumns(infile, outfile)¶

build multiple alignments.

pipeline_variants.mergeMultipleAlignments(infiles, outfile)¶

collect multiple alignment results into files that are compatible with OPTIC.

pipeline_variants.buildPolyphenInput(infiles, outfile)¶

build polyphen input file.

SNPS across all species are aggregated into a single file to avoid multiple submissions for the same variant.

Mapping to Uniprot ids was not successful - 40% of the SNPs would have been lost. Hence I map to ensembl protein identifiers. Note that the sequence file is then to be submitted to POLYPHEN as well.

Note that this method outputs 1-based coordinates for polyphen, while the coordinates in the .map file are still 0-based.

SNPs are assigned a snp_id and a locus_id. The snp_id refers to the SNP within a peptide sequence while the locus_id refers to the genomic location. If there are alternative transcripts overlapping a SNP, the same SNP will get two snp_ids, but the same locus_id. As the peptide background might be different for the same SNP depending on the transcript, its effect needs to be predicted twice.

pipeline_variants.buildPolyphenFeatures(infile, outfile)¶

run polyphen on the cluster.

To do this, first send uniref to all nodes:

python ~/cgat/cluster_distribute.py
–collection=andreas /net/cpp-group/tools/polyphen-2.0.18/nrdb/uniref100*.{pin,psd,psi,phr,psq,pal}
pipeline_variants.runPolyphen(infile, outfile, model)¶

run POLYPHEN on feature tables to classify SNPs.

pipeline_variants.loadPolyphenMap(infile, outfile)¶

load polyphen input data.

pipeline_variants.loadPolyphen(infile, outfile)¶

load polyphen results.

pipeline_variants.analysePolyphen(infile, outfile)¶

compute enrichment of SNPs within genes and deleterious SNPs within SNPs within genes.

del: enrichment of deleterious snps within snps per gene len: enrichment of snps within genes com: enrichment of deleterious snps within gene

pipeline_variants.loadPolyphenAnalysis(infile, outfile)¶

load polyphen analysis results.

pipeline_variants.buildSharedSNPMatrix(infiles, outfiles)¶

build matrix of shared coding nonsynonymous SNPs.

Counts are per locus id.

Percent identities are only within coding segregating loci and thus do not reflect the real divergence.

pipeline_variants.buildSNPDensityIsochores(infile, outfile)¶

build isochores with SNP density.

pipeline_variants.runGATOnQTLs(infiles, outfile)¶

run enrichment analysisusing the qtl definitions from Jonathan Flint’s group.

pipeline_variants.runGATOnQTLsSmall(infiles, outfile)¶

run enrichment analysisusing the qtl definitions from Jonathan Flint’s group.

pipeline_variants.createMGI(infile, outfile)¶

get GO assignments from MGI

pipeline_variants.buildGeneMatrix(tracks, analysis, statement, outfile)¶

build a gene matrix.

A gene matrix is an n x m matrix for n genes and m gene lists. Each column contains a 1 if a gene is present in a gene list, otherwise it is 0.

pipeline_variants.buildGeneMatrixEffects(infiles, outfile)¶

build gene matrix with consequences data.

Note that this analysis is confounded by gene length.

pipeline_variants.buildGeneMatrixAlleles(infiles, outfile)¶

build gene matrix from alleles results

options is a tuple of (track, analysis, ontology)

analysis can be:

stoptruncated
genes that are truncated due to stops
nmdknockout
genes that are knocked out due to NMD
splicetruncated
genes that are truncated due to deleted splice sites
knockout
any of the above

Note that the analysis here needs to be background adjusted. NMD transcripts and splice truncated transcripts are only multiple exon transcripts, while stoptruncated ones are only single exon ones.

pipeline_variants.buildGeneMatrixConsequences(infiles, outfile)¶

build gene matrix from effecs results

nmdknockouttranscript
genes for which one transcript has been knocked out due to NMD
nmdaffectedtranscript
genes in which one transcript is affected by NMD
nmdknockoutgenes
genes in which all transcripts have been knocked out due to NMD

Note that the analysis here needs to be background adjusted. For example, NMD transcripts are only multiple exon transcripts.

pipeline_variants.runGeneListAnalysis(infiles, outfile)¶

run a gene list analysis.

pipeline_variants.loadGeneListAnalysis(infile, outfile)¶

load gene list analysis results.

pipeline_variants.clone(infile, outfile)¶

clone a pipeline using symbolic links.

pipeline_variants.createViewGenes(infile, outfile)¶

create view in database for genes.

This view aggregates all information on a per-gene basis. There is only a single entry per gene.

pipeline_variants.build_report()¶

build report from scratch.

pipeline_variants.update_report()¶

update report.
